summary:
This mod makes many of the existing effects from quest objects, shouts or ablilities applicable via enchanting or alchemy.
It also adds many cool new effects and recipes for potions and poisons, as well as the rarest ingredients to new merchants.
descriptionHtml:
New Alchemy and Enchanting Effects
=============================================================================


PLEASE ENDORSE! GIMME SOME NERD LOVE!


Announcement: This Update mainly fixes some bugs. Please report if you find one!
              I will keep expanding this mod as I learn new features of the kit, so \'do come back\'.

News:       - added an extremely cool ring and spell to Lucy\'s shop:
                - Ring of the Nighthunter: At night, while crouching, you are invisible. (removed Ring of Invisibility, was a gamebreaker in oblivion already!)
                - Spell Predator         : Become invisible, detect life and backstab effect for 60 sec. (Best assasine spell ever!!!)
                       

This mod makes many of the existing effects from quest objects, shouts or ablilities applicable via enchanting or alchemy.
It also adds many cool new effects and recipes for potions and poisons, as well as the rarest ingredients to new merchants.
Some ingredients are just too rare in vanilla skyrim now you can at least get them for a lot of cash.
You can buy rings with the new enchantments from the merchants, disenchant them and put the effect on another object.

COMPLETE STANDALONE! Compatible with everything!

Most of the stuff is for mid- to lategame, so I made it very expensive. Nice new way to spend money if you got plenty...


New Stuff: (only some of it)
=============================

Enchanting:  - Speed, Luck, Fire Cloak, Candlelight, Ward, Fortify Enchanting, Absorb Spells, Fortify Magic Magnitude/Duration,
               Permanently Summon Dragon, Falmer, Sabrecat, Bambi amd many more.
               New Dragon Damage and Dragonrend Enchantment

Alchemy:     - Dragonrend, Dragon Damage, Fire paste for burning arrows, etc
 
Recipes:     - Recipes for the most complicated potions and poisons. Scroll down for details. 

Ingredients: - Jarrin Root, Human Heart, Human Flesh, basiclly all available ingredients can be purchased. Some new ingredients.

Gear:        - Nocturnal/Thalmor Mage Outfit (as powerful as archmage but more aggressive), more to come...

Weapons:     - Staff of Jealousy, Staff of Vampiric Nature (at the Medicus)
              
             

Recipes:   
================
- Double Tap:       Dam Health, Ling. Dam Health
- Shields down:     Weakness to Fire / Frost / Poison
- Crippler:         Dam Health, Slow 50%
- Madman:           Dam Health / Magicka / Magicka rate, Frenzy
- Berserk:          Dam Health / Stamina / Magicka / Magicka Regeneration, Frenzy
- Overkill:         Dam Health, Ling Dam Health, Ravage Magicka, Paralyze
- Reaper:           Ravage Health / Stamina, Dam Health / Samina Regeneratin, Resist Frost
- The Stunner:      Paralyze / Dam Health / Ling Dam Health
- Superbad:         Dam Health / Magicka / Stamina / Magicka Regeneration
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
- Out of here!:     Fortify Carry and Stamina
- Slow Healing:     Fortify Health and Magicka Regeneration
- Sharpshooter:     Fortify Marksman
- Hero Warrior:     Fortify Two Handed, Stamina and Fire Resistance
- Hero Defense:     Fortify Health, Health Regen, Heavy Armor and Fire Resistance
- Ubermage:         Fortify Magicka, Rgenerate Magicka, Fortify Destruction


... and many more. Most potions and poisons are self explaining. Try Dead Man Walking or Backstabbing Poison. They are badass!

I tried to balance it to blend naturally into the game. Please comment for improvements.



Lore
==============================================================================

A strange guy hangs out at the Bee & Barb in Riften. Folks call him the \'Black Medicus\' but nobody knows his real name. 
Actually, nobody likes him being at the pub, but they don\'t have the guts to send him away.

Characters who don\'t fear moving in legally gray areas, may find that the Medicus has some interesting stuff to sell though...

The Medicus is a Master of Poisons and sells some stuff the other merchants wouldn\'t dare to. 
He knows the recipes for the real badass poisons with up to four effects. He\'ll also sell you some very rare ingredients to create them, including human flesh and heart. 
Some of his homemade poisons are worth trying too...

Meanwhile in Dawnstar, the daughter of old Frida in the Mortar & Pestle has returned from her studies in Cyrodil.
She discovered some interesting new enchanting effects like making oneself faster and dragon damage.
Also, she brought a stunning and powerful mage outfit from Divine Elegance in the Imperial City. Worth the Price!!!!

At the bridge in Riverwood, a shady guy from a long line of shady guys has arrived in skyrim to sell... wait for it... lockpicks.
Actually he also sells most crafting items. Useful.


============================================================================

Install:
-	Copy file to skyrim/Data folder manually or via mod-manager.
-	Activate file via launcher or mod-manager.

Update:
-	Deactivate old file via launcher or mod-manager.
-	Delete old file from skyrim/Data folder manually or via mod-manager.
-	Copy new file to skyrim/Data folder manually or via mod-manager.
-	Activate new file via launcher or mod-manager.


Uninstall
-	Deactivate file via launcher or mod-manager.
-	Delete file from skyrim/Data folder manually or via mod-manager.

=============================================================================


If you would like to share some of your best recipes, I will implement them in the mod.
Also, it would be awesome if someone can tell me how to make the guy an alchemy trainer.


Until then, enjoyâ€¦


Joe316






log
=============================
Update 1.9
============
- Bugs fixed, all enchantments can now be transfered.
- New Spell and Ring

Update 1.8
============
-cleaned up! Medicus only sells alchemy, Lucy sells enchanting, Sam sells crafting equipment.
- Fixed the prices
- added Summon Dragon Constant Ring, Dragonrend Enchant, many more.
- New Staffs at the Medicus. Check them out!

Update 1.7
============
- Fixes
- New effects


Update 1.6
============
- New effects: Fortify Luck, Spell Absorb Enchant, Ward Enchant, Candlelight Enchant, many more
- New Outfit: Nocturnal Robes with sick lategame enchantment (beats the Arch-Mage Outfit).
- Shady Sam! New merchant in Riverwood.


Update 1.5
============
- Added missing fortify magic school enchantments. You can buy rings with the enchantments from Lucy.
  Those rings can be disenchanted, and you can enchant other items with it.


Update 1.4
============
- New hardcore potion recipes available at the white medicus, Lucy.
- Rcipes: - Out of here!: Fortify Carry and Stamina
          - Slow Healing: Fortify Health and Magicka Regeneration
          - Sharpshooter: Fortify Marksman
          - Hero Warrior: Fortify Two Handed, Stamina and Fire Resistance
          - Hero Defense: Fortify Health, Health Regen, Heavy Armor and Fire Resistance
          - Ubermage    : Fortify Magicka, Rgenerate Magicka, Fortify Destruction

        

Update 1.3
============
- The Medicus now sells a Jarrin Root. It\'s very expensice though...


Update 1.2
============
- More lore-friendly name by request.
- New Poisons.
- Added a very special amulet to the medicus.
- New NPC Lucy at the Mortar & Pestle in Dawnstar.
- New alchemical effects (Speed!)
- Changed prices for ready poisons. It really makes sense to buy the recipes instead now.
- New Poisons cookable at cooking pot.
- Some fixes.


Update 1.1
============
- New Poison effects: Dragonrend, Dragon-damage, Firepaste (Fire-Arrows!!!)
- New Poisons for sale
- Spectacular new poison recipes worth their money. The big daddys of poison!!!
author: Joe316
